profile.headline: Engineering Manager at Airtable
profile.summary: Software engineering manager with 11+ years of experience in infrastructure, continuous integration, automated testing and app development.

experiences.title: Engineering Manager
experiences.description: Airtable is the No-Code App Platform that empowers people closest to the work to accelerate their most critical business processes.

experiences.title: Software Development Manager in Test
experiences.description:
• Managed a team of SDETs delivering functional, performance and analytics test automation solutions to product teams working on 6 first-party iOS applications.
• Guided the team through a major test framework architecture redesign in Swift, XCTest, Xcode, Xcode Cloud.
• Collaborated with engineering, QA, design and program teams to define priorities and balance workload.
• Helped engineers grow by aligning their career goals with department needs, coaching and performance reviews.

experiences.title: Mobile Application Developer
experiences.description: • Developed and published multiple cross-platform mobile applications written in C#, Xamarin, Xamarin.Forms, Swift and Java. Combined downloads exceed 10,000 per year.

experiences.title: Lead Software Test Automation Engineer
experiences.description:
• Led a team of 3 engineers developing test automation for 3 different iOS applications.
• Reduced testing time by 70-80% (from 48-72 to 16-30 hours) by automating test cases for all 3 apps.
• Built custom testing solutions with a shared core for each iOS app from scratch using Swift, XCTest, XCUITest; integrated it with Report Portal using REST API and included in the CI process in buddybuild & Xcode Server.
• Coached 7 test automation engineers for customer interviews with 86% success rate (6 out of 7 were hired).
• Interviewed internal and external candidates for different projects and provided feedback to hiring managers.
experiences.location: New York, New York, United States

experiences.title: Senior Software Test Automation Engineer

• Reduced testing time by 87% (from 40 to 5 hours) by automating 80% of all functional tests.
• Built automated testing solution using C#, MSTest, TestStack.White, Team Foundation Server (TFS).

experiences.title: Senior Software Test Automation Engineer
experiences.description:
• Reduced testing time by 81% (from 16 to 3 hours) by automating all manual tests using PHP, Selenium WebDriver and scheduling test runs in Jenkins.
• Mentored a team of manual QA engineers while they adopted automated testing workflows.

experiences.title: Software Test Automation Engineer
experiences.description: • Reduced regression testing time by 75% (from 8 to 2 hours) by building a test framework from scratch, automating all manual test cases using C#, NUnit, Selenium WebDriver, TestRail and integrating automated tests into Atlassian Bamboo CI pipelines.

profile.headline: Engineering Manager at Airtable
profile.summary:
I currently manage the Performance & Architecture team at Airtable.

Before that, I was an early software engineer at Cloudera, then tech lead and manager for Cloudera's HDFS team for many years, and then worked in the go-to-market side for Cloudera's cloud products. I joined Cloudera when it was about 30 people, and by the time I left it had grown to about 3,000. During that time I was involved in all aspects of HDFS development, and became an Apache Hadoop Committer and PMC Member.

Specialties: distributed systems, storage, Hadoop and Hadoop ecosystem, systems programming, systems security, web programming

experiences.title: Engineering Manager
experiences.description: I manage the engineering teams focused on high-scale use cases of Airtable.

experiences.title: Apache Hadoop PMC Member and Committer
Chief Technologist, Cloud
experiences.description: Worked closely with both our eng/product teams and our cloud sales specialist team to help onboard customers and make them successful with Cloudera's newest cloud offering, Cloudera Data Platform - Public Cloud (CDP-PC), the successor to Cloudera Altus. Responsible for much of the internal infrastructure to roll out Cloudera CDP-PC to internal field-facing users so they could familiarize themselves with this new product. Responsible for routing and prioritizing field requests to product/engineering teams.

experiences.title: Principal Field Technologist
experiences.description: I worked on Cloudera's then-newly-formed cloud go-to-market team, focusing on all things related to development and adoption of Cloudera Altus. Worked especially closely with Cloudera's cloud sales specialists to help land and onboard customers to Cloudera Altus.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description:
2014-2018 - Tech Lead and people manager of Cloudera's HDFS team. Directly managed up to 6 development engineers, and indirectly managed 4 additional customer-centric engineers. Helped to oversee the design and development of HDFS erasure coding, Hadoop-compatible S3/Azure connectors, review the development of HDFS snapshots, and the release of Apache Hadoop 3.0, the first new major release of Hadoop in many years. Responsible for interfacing with both support and product management functions focused on HDFS. Worked with many other engineering teams within Cloudera which built primarily on top of HDFS.

2013-2014 - Tech Lead for Cloudera's HDFS team. Worked closely with the both the product and people managers of the HDFS team to prioritize work, design new features, and address customer problems. Worked with other members of the Apache Hadoop open source community to advance all aspects of HDFS development.

2011-2013 - Worked as a software engineer on the HDFS team. One of the primary developers of HDFS's High Availability feature, but also contributed many other smaller features, especially in the areas of metadata durability, Hadoop security, and HDFS NFS gateway access. Was one of the top contributors to open source HDFS during this time. Also a great deal of hands-on customer support, both after-hours and to assist Cloudera's full-time support staff. Became a Hadoop Committer and PMC Member.

2010-2011 - Worked as a software on Cloudera Desktop, which is in some ways the predecessor of both Cloudera Hue and Cloudera Manager. On this team I introduced two major features: user/group sync with LDAP, and a file system search feature for HDFS called "Headlamp". I also led the integration of Cloudera Desktop with core Hadoop's then-new Kerberos authentication system.

experiences.title: VP of Engineering, Senior Software Engineer, Production Manager
experiences.description:
Worked on all software components of http://amiestreet.com.

Overhauled all Flex music players on amiestreet.com in preparation for a complete redesign of the site.

Responsible for production deployment and updating of amiestreet.com.

Helped to establish and maintain continuous integration/performance tests, both functional and unit testing.

As part of operations team, responsible for administration and debugging of production server environment.

experiences.title: Systems Programmer Operator and Consultant (SPOC)
experiences.description:
Assisted in the installation, maintenance, development, and documentation of local software.

Provided technical support for a network of over 500 Linux and Windows workstations and servers.

Involved in the resolution of systems-level problems and support for third-party software.

experiences.title: Software Engineer Intern
experiences.description:
Worked on developing a new Flash video player for YouTube

Integrated a library for displaying and tracking advertisements into a Flash video player.

Extended advertising library to support display of a new advertising format.

Coordinated with server engineers at YouTube and Google to enable communication with various servers and the video player.

experiences.title: Software Engineer Intern
experiences.description:
Crafted a program to administrate high-volume servers providing rich media.

Collaborated with server administrators and content providers in designing program.

Currently in use by several telecommunications companies in both the U.S. and Japan.

recommendations:
Charles Zedlewski



Aaron's an OK software engineer.  Maybe.  Move along.  Nothing to see here...

Aaron Newton



Working next to Aaron (that's ATM to those who know him) requires constant vigilance. Sure, he's a bad ass developer who has the work stamina of a pack of mules, but all that takes a back seat when you consider his razor sharp wit. No, you can't softball things over the plate with ATM and not expect him to drive it out of the park. Even a curve ball rarely gets by him. Simply put, working next to ATM means that you have to bring your A game not only in your own work to live up to his shining example of productivity and elegant code, you have to do it while sparring with him mentally. He keeps you sharp, on your toes. As much as this "recommendation" is a warning, I'd welcome the opportunity to work with him again if for no other reason than it would keep me in shape.

profile.occupation: Engineering Manager, Storage & Data Infrastructure at Airtable
profile.headline: Engineering Manager at Airtable
profile.summary: I am a technical leader with a background in databases, distributed systems, and machine learning infrastructure. I enjoy working on hard problems that require deep thinking and continuous, applied effort. I believe that software engineering is a team sport, and want to work with people that share the same values but possess complementary strengths.

experiences.title: Engineering Manager, Storage & Data Infrastructure
experiences.description:
I support the Storage and Data Infrastructure teams at Airtable. We are responsible for providing powerful, reliable, and easy-to-use storage and query abstractions used by product development teams and internal data users. These abstractions are built on top of technologies like MySQL, DynamoDB, TiDB, Databricks, Spark, Kinesis, Flink, and Starrocks.

As the manager, I am responsible for setting the vision and strategy for the teams, driving execution of key initiatives, and supporting and mentoring my reports. I work with cross-team and cross-functional stakeholders to align business and project priorities. I also run our engineering-wide incident management process and our engineering blog.

Here are some recent projects my team and I have worked on:
- An S3-backed database for transactional logging workloads, with 100x improved cost-efficiency compared to RDS MySQL
- Migrating our analytics workloads from Redshift to Databricks
- A real-time streaming and analytics platform based on Flink and Starrocks, which powers analytical product features for our highest-scale enterprise customers.

experiences.title: Engineering Manager, Storage
experiences.description:
I support the Storage team, whose mission is to accelerate product development at Airtable by providing scalable, reliable, and easy-to-use storage abstractions. Our primary storage system is MySQL, with Redis for in-memory caching and DynamoDB for key-value workloads.

I grew the team from just myself to seven engineers. Here's a sampling of projects that we've worked on:

- Upgrading from MySQL 5.6 to MySQL 8.0 (see: https://medium.com/airtable-eng/migrating-airtable-to-mysql-8-0-809f0398a493)
- Launching a new key-value storage abstraction built on top of DynamoDB
- Introducing TiDB for high-scale, business-critical relational storage workloads
- Redesigning our ProxySQL infrastructure to 100x our MySQL connection scalability
- Improving scalability of our read-heavy MySQL workloads with highly-available and low-lag read replicas

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description: I worked on the Data Infrastructure team, where I led the development of our feature flagging and experimentation system, developed and maintained data pipelines, and made improvements to our Airflow and cloud infrastructure.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description:
Scale provides high-quality training data for AI applications. I was the first senior hire in engineering, joining during the Series B.

As a member of the Platform team, I was responsible for improving the infrastructure and code abstractions powering Scale's products, as well as our observability, build/test/release, and data warehousing infrastructure.

Projects I worked on:

- Monitoring and observability. I rolled out structured logging within the company and maintained our ELK cluster. Setup alerts and dashboards for our production systems and defined per-team SLIs and SLOs. Led migration of our monitoring from New Relic to Datadog.
- Initiated use of Terraform for managing our cloud infrastructure. This allowed us to audit and version infrastructure changes and easily manage additional production and test environments.
- Developed an automated daily release process and canary environment for testing with production traffic. This greatly reduced the number of site incidents, improved developer efficiency, and sped up testing feedback loops.
- Led migration of our data warehouse from AWS Athena to Snowflake. I evaluated a number of different data warehousing technologies, coordinated the migration of our production data and query workload, and performed training sessions for dozens of SQL users at the company.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description:
I joined Cloudera as approximately employee #300. This was an incredible experience at a growth-stage company. By the time I left, it was about 3000 people.

HDFS (2012-2017):

HDFS is the most successful open-source distributed storage system. I joined as one of three engineers developing HDFS at Cloudera, and became the tech lead for a team of ten.

Some project highlights:

- Led development of erasure coding, a new method of storing data that reduces storage costs by more than 50%. This was a multi-year project that involved novel research ideas and coordinating 20+ developers across multiple companies and multiple timezones. This is the biggest and most complex effort we've ever shipped in HDFS.
- Release manager for Apache Hadoop 3.0, the biggest release of Hadoop ever. This was spurred by our desire to ship erasure coding, and required coordinating with multiple feature owners and downstream ecosystem dependencies over the course of more than a year of alpha and beta releases. I made substantial improvements to our release tools, process, and testing along the way. Hadoop 3.0 was the foundation of Cloudera 6, Cloudera's first major release in five years.
- Became an Apache Hadoop committer, PMC member, and Apache Member due to my open-source contributions. Mentored multiple coworkers and community contributors into becoming committers and PMC members themselves.
- Presented at conferences including Strata Hadoop World, Hadoop Summit, Apachecon, Apache Big Data, and USENIX ATC.

Altus (2017-2019)

Altus was Cloudera's Platform-as-a-Service offering, making it easy to run machine learning and data engineering workloads on the cloud.

- Led development of a cloud-native machine learning platform built on Kubernetes.
- Made improvements to Altus core services, observability, and build/test/deploy infrastructure.

experiences.title: PHD Student
experiences.description: PhD track graduate student in distributed systems, advised by Professor Ion Stoica. Published papers at top-tier conferences (OSDI, SOCC) about in-memory caching for distributed filesystems and providing SLOs for heterogeneous storage workloads.

education.school: Thomas Jefferson High School for Science and Technology

accomplishment_publications.name: The Next Generation of Apache Hadoop: Open Problems in Distributed Storage and Resource Management
CrowdDB: Query Processing with the VLDB Crowd
Cake: Enabling High-level SLOs on Shared Storage Systems

profile.headline: Passionate about helping organizations with compelling missions reach their goals
profile.summary:
After a 20-year career in healthcare IT helping hundreds of clients maximize efficiency in areas of registration and scheduling through consulting work, process redesign sessions, and software design and development, I followed a personal passion to help families find a healthy balance with technology.  This pivot gave me the opportunity to grow my skills in a very different direction.  I was fortunate to work with a growing non-profit where I not only learned about completely new-to-me concepts like fundraising and distribution, but also how the benefits of quality data management can impact operations for non-profits.  I have an expanding appreciation for the intersection of data quality and efficiency within organizations of all shapes and sizes and would love to use what I've learned to help teams gain efficiency in all aspects of their businesses and/or missions.

Strengths include:
Process Improvement
Data Modeling + Organization
Airtable Interface Design + Build
Email Automations
Website Maintenance

recommendations:
Holly Johnson, PMP, MBA, CSM



It was my privilege to work with Abby at Cerner for several years. She was a rare find in the workplace. I never saw her commitment in her job waiver yet she didn't take herself too seriously. She was professional but warm and though very, very busy (she knew all there was to know about our solution) she would still gladly make time for anyone who was invested in learning and contributing more to our work. I still keep in touch with Abby and she will do amazing things as an ambassador at START.

Brad Scott



I had the pleasure of working with Abby on a number of projects through years and she was always so collaborative and extremely approachable.  Abby is someone who brings out the very best in those she interacts with because of her warmth and compassion.  Abby understands the urgency of the present and maximizes every opportunity to advance the business.

profile.headline: Enterprise Support Specialist at Airtable
profile.summary:
I am a relationship builder with a very strong focus on customer satisfaction. 

Through years of experience within Customer Service and Sales based roles, I developed excellent attention to detail and the ability to adjust to all situations. I thrive in busy working environments and welcome new challenges to enhance my professional skills and experience.

experiences.title: Enterprise Support Specialist
experiences.description:
Airtable is the No-Code App Platform that empowers people closest to the work to accelerate their most critical business processes.

Role: 
- Diagnose and troubleshoot technical problems via email and video calls, delivering step-by-step solutions.
- Maintain a strong understanding of Airtable features: writing formulas, relational databases, synchronisation and automation settings.
- Educate customers on the product and best practices.
- Foster strong relationships with Customer Success Managers and business partners to align support efforts.
- Contribute to and update knowledge bases (Guru, playbooks) with resolved customer issues.
- Communicate customer feedback to internal teams for product and service improvements.

profile.occupation: Content strategist / Technical writer / Content Ops at Airtable
profile.headline: Resolving customer confusion through AI-infused self-serve resourcing
profile.summary:
A turning point in my life was a wonderful internship at Yosemite National Park in California during the summer of 2010.  It was amazing for both the work I was involved in and the free time I had to discover myself while meeting many wonderful people. That internship lead to a permanent position as a park ranger in Yosemite. In this role I offered top level customer service to people from all over the world and found ways to provide creative insights and solutions alongside my NPS colleagues. Highlights included a 5 month detail overseeing our campground volunteer program and many wonderful personal relationships built over time with repeat visitors.

In April 2020, I moved on from the National Park Service to pursue a new career in the ever-changing world of software technology as a Customer Support Advocate for Airtable. With this evolution in my career I aimed to continue to provide top-level customer care while learning about and experimenting with new ways to share information in a remote-friendly world with a thirst for visually pleasing content. 

I've since moved on to be a technical writer, KMS system manager, and AI chatbot optimizer as part of Airtable's Self-serve Support team.

My aspirations outside of work are to remain active outdoors through my love of backpacking, climbing, and running. I also endeavor to continue exploring the world of art through music and other mediums.

Specialties: Customer Service, research, data entry and manipulation, supervision, and exploring creative solutions

experiences.title: Content strategist / Technical writer / Content Ops
experiences.description:
- Operationalizing team processes (multi-source intake, pipeline / help center change management, metric dashboards) through a customized Airtable apps ecosystem
- AI chatbot implemetation, strategy, and calibration 
- Technical writing supporting product launches, product updates/fixes, and common customer questions (customer and internal facing)
- Airtable expert quality assurance and testing
- Knowledge Base / Support Center management, development, and curation via a backend KMS
- Identify key OKRs and reporting metrics
- Provide thought-provoking and realistic process feedback
- HTML/CSS troubleshooting
- Localization/Translation planning supporting multiple languages
- Implementing and operationalizing KCS solve and evolve loops across the Support org

experiences.title: Technical Writer/Support Ops
experiences.description:
- Supporting both customers and Airtable's internal teams by creating helpful content in our support center 
- Using Figma to create eye-catching, on-brand visuals
- Using CloudApp and other video content production tools to create helpful video guides of technical concepts
- Gaining new insights from Airtable's talented online community through community involvement and moderation

experiences.title: Customer Support Advocate
experiences.description: In this role, I helped people and businesses to streamline and troubleshoot their projects in a customer support capacity. I also helped to create and edit content in our customer facing support center. Airtable is a SaaS database software that provides a fresh vision of what traditional spreadsheets have been missing, including low and no-code software solutions. Collaboration and user empowerment are Airtable's Mission!

experiences.title: Freelance Musician
experiences.description: As a member of Osos Peligrosos, I am a multi-instrumentalist, singer, and producer. I have navigated the "Do-It-Yourself" side of the modern music industry, finding a way to distribute a self-funded album project on major platforms such as Apple Music and Spotify. This has has led to a deeper understanding of what it takes to share art, while still remaining true to myself. After successfully distributing our first album "Easy Mind", Osos Peligrosos continues to make music and hopes to release another album in the near future. Find us on almost any streaming platform.
